{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3578713,"name":"CEF","username":"CEF","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/35a633/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-04-03T01:08:30.849Z","cooked":"

Thanks to a generous grant, some sponsorships and some fundraising we are now in a position to get a CNC router for the team. We understand that the Omio X8-2200L-USB is sort of the go-to router for FRC Teams, so that’s the direction we were leaning. Until about an hour ago, that is, when I learned about the aggregate 54% tariff on goods from China. So much winning.

So, if we’re going to go with a US manufacturer, who do we choose?

shopbot routers have been used extensively by frc teams and most have great reviews. they also have a wide range of options

check em out at https://shopbottools.com/

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2025-04-03T01:14:25.130Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":380,"readers_count":379,"score":76.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":497872,"topic_slug":"cnc-alternatives","display_username":"Ian Bae","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://shopbottools.com/","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Top CNC Router Manufacturer | ShopBot Tools | Made in USA","clicks":44}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63388,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"frc 694!!"},"post_url":"/t/cnc-alternatives/497872/2","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3578747,"name":"Ardiano Works","username":"MSU2000","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/msu2000/{size}/190139_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-03T01:19:00.718Z","cooked":"

What’s your budget?

Shapeoko Pro/HDM for under $6K. Shapeoko is super easy to use.

A step up from this would be AVID Benchtop Pro 3X3 or Langmuir MR1. Langmuir is fully enclosed able to run coolant, which is cool but the bed size is under 24X24.

I assume you will be cutting Aluminum, so having 3X3 bed would be great, you can put the entire belly pan on it. I personally like AVID Benchtop Pro 3X3 but they are little spendy for what it is but AVID is pretty reputable and have great support.

If your budget is $15K and up, you’re in entry entry level industrial, then you have machine like ShopBot, Laguna, ShopSabre.

I like Phanton CNC, but the shipping to my area would be almost 30% of the machine price.

I’m in the same boat currently, trying to figure out what CNC style router. Thinking about piecing it together, cheaper and you get good quality, just need to design and assemble it.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2025-04-03T01:31:57.260Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":357,"readers_count":356,"score":86.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":497872,"topic_slug":"cnc-alternatives","display_username":"Ardiano Works","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57747,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/cnc-alternatives/497872/3","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3578843,"name":"Patrick","username":"Patrick3357","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/patrick3357/{size}/169915_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-03T01:34:20.384Z","cooked":"

We love our Avid. If you’ve got the budget and space, a 4’x4’ or larger opens lots of capacity for field build, shop furniture, and case building, not to mention increasing yield by not having to cut all your stock into smaller chunks. Buying a large router was a game changer for us.

What’s your budget?

Thx. Budget is around $5k, give-or-take

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2025-04-03T01:35:02.492Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":273,"readers_count":272,"score":64.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":497872,"topic_slug":"cnc-alternatives","display_username":"CEF","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":28649,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/cnc-alternatives/497872/5","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3578906,"name":"Ardiano Works","username":"MSU2000","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/msu2000/{size}/190139_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-03T02:15:27.871Z","cooked":"

Shapeoko, Onefinity. My daugther uses Shapeoko Pro at her school and it does the job. Never seen Onefinity up close though.

There are other “kit” from CNC4newbie, MillRight Mega V2, PwnCNC, but I’d probably stick with Shapeoko Pro.

IF you don’t need the 4X4 bed, I’d get the Shapeoko HDM or stripped down Langmuir MR1. This is more rigid of a machine and pretty awesome on Aluminum, and it’ll be low $5K ish. Having 220V gets you better router/spindle option.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2025-04-03T02:18:25.390Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":250,"readers_count":249,"score":50.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":497872,"topic_slug":"cnc-alternatives","display_username":"Ardiano Works","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":28649,"username":"CEF","name":"CEF","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/35a633/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57747,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/cnc-alternatives/497872/6","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3578910,"name":"Cory","username":"Cory","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cory/{size}/312_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-03T02:21:29.811Z","cooked":"

Are you sure any of these machines other than Shapeoko and Shopbot are made in the US?

Avid clearly states “designed and supported in the US” → China made

Langmuir references assembly in the US → Chinese fabricated.

Laguna is a machine importer → China

Phantom - makes references to having customized the design of the machines which he got from China. Looks like they might do some assembly domestically.

Regardless of whether a machine is straight up from china or assembled in the US, or even made in the US, you’re talking about a price point at which there is zero chance the machine isn’t loaded with Chinese components, which will drive the BOM cost up, which will get passed on to you.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2025-04-03T02:22:03.559Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":240,"readers_count":239,"score":118.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":497872,"topic_slug":"cnc-alternatives","display_username":"Cory","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":57747,"username":"MSU2000","name":"Ardiano Works","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/msu2000/{size}/190139_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":1037,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/cnc-alternatives/497872/7","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3578916,"name":"jedgar6","username":"jedgar6","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jedgar6/{size}/200602_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-03T02:29:20.617Z","cooked":"

Shapeoko says their production split between California and Illinois. Also I think you could still buy from them and others’ whose stock is still in the USA right now. Sneak in as it be.

Cory:

Regardless of whether a machine is straight up from china or assembled in the US, or even made in the US, you’re talking about a price point at which there is zero chance the machine isn’t loaded with Chinese components, which will drive the BOM cost up, which will get passed on to you.

True, but I called AVID 2 weeks ago and the quote I got was as advertised online. MillRight out of the door quote was also still as advertised as of yesterday. Onefinity clearly stated in their website that their price is not going to be affected. Who knows how long they will honor this.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2025-04-03T03:20:24.716Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":185,"readers_count":184,"score":47.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":497872,"topic_slug":"cnc-alternatives","display_username":"Ardiano Works","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57747,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/cnc-alternatives/497872/9","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3579588,"name":"Brian Bartholmai","username":"DrB","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/drb/{size}/189693_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-03T22:24:24.067Z","cooked":"

We have been very very happy with the MillRight PowerRoutePlus. Super accurate and rigid and very inexpensive if you use the GRBL control system and a controller like CNCJS. We have machined way more than 100 parts up to 5/8” aluminum with no problem. Polycarbonate and Delrin super easy.

They may offer a FRC discount if you email them. I have worked with Derek to get the right configuration for our team—they have a lot of choices from very rigid and small to full 4x8’ sheet.

MillRight CNC, LLC

MillRight CNC | CNC Machines for Makers and Businesses

MillRight CNC manufactures performance CNC machines that help you make real parts in wood, plastic, and even metals. We offer the best value in CNC for makers and businesses. Offering both desktop CNC and full size tables.

derek@millrightcnc.com
